topic.title: Organizations
topic.p: Organizations provide top-level structuring of all entities inside Qodana Cloud. Each organization can contain several teams, users, and projects. Each Qodana Cloud user can be a member of several organizations.
By default, a private organization is assigned to your account. This already lets you create projects and aggregate Qodana reports without joining or creating any other organizations.
The Organizations tab of the Settings section contains a list of organizations that your account is associated with.

chapter.title: Managing organizations
chapter.p: To create a new organization, on the Organizations tab click the + Add new organization link. This will open the dialog window to specify the organization name and its visibility for other Qodana Cloud accounts.
After creating, you can use the left sidebar of the Qodana Cloud UI to have access to the list of organizations.
To delete the organization, click the upper-right corner and then click Archive organization.

chapter.title: Managing members and visibility
chapter.p: If your account has the Administrator for specific organizations, it lets you create and delete such organizations, as well as manage their members and visibility.
To manage members and visibility of the existing organization, on the Organizations tab click the Manage members and visibility link. Using the Invite people to <organization_name> window, you can:
